body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Square Enix is enacting a round of mass layoffs, according to multiple reports. IGN and VGC reported that Square Enix informed affected staff today that cuts are being made as part of a "fundamental restructuring of the overseas publishing organization," referring to the company's Western business.Cuts are beng made in Europe and America to help Square Enix become more "lean" and "agile," president Takashi Kiryu told staff. The extent of the cuts was not confirmed, but VGC reported that at almost 140 people at the London office alone were "at risk" of being laid off. The cuts are affecting various departments, including IT, marketing, publishing, sales, QA, and business planning, the report said.In 2024, Square Enix also made cuts to its Western teams. Square Enix also sold assets as part of its reorganization effort, selling developers like Crystal Dynamics, Eidos-Montreal, and Square Enix Montreal to Embracer. Square Enix's latest earnings briefing included a slide detailing how the company would conduct a "fundamental restructuring of the overseas publishing organization" with the aim of "further strengthening global publishing capabilities and improving operational efficiency."Square Enix is projecting an annual cost savings of more than 3 billion yen ($19.6 million) as part of the restructuring. Another effort Square Enix is undertaking is further adoption of AI, with the company recently announcing it wants to use genAI to automate 70% of game QA by 2027.

title: You Can Play Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 And Four More Games For Free On Xbox This Weekend
description: By     Darryn Bonthuys   on November 6, 2025 at 9:28AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Darryn Bonthuys
   on November 6, 2025 at 9:28AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                There's no denying that video games can be expensive, but every month, Xbox hosts Free Play Day Weekends where users can check out a title for the low cost of absolutely nothing. For November, one of the biggest games of the year--Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2--will be free to play for all Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and Essential members, and it'll be joined by a varied selection of other games that you can check out, without needing a Game Pass subscription. The November Free Play Days weekend starts on November 6 and runs through Sunday, November 9.Each game is easy to access. PC users can find each of the individual game details pages on the Xbox website--we've included those links below--while console users will need to click on the Subscriptions tab in the Xbox Store and navigate down to the Free Play Days collection on Xbox One or Xbox Series X|S. If you like what you play, you can get a discount on the game for a limited time and continue your adventure.Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2One of the early hits of 2025, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is an open-world RPG that improves on its predecessor in virtually every area. Czech developer Warhorse Studios has released DLC for the game since launch and its final expansion--Mysteria Ecclesia--launches on November 11.Free to play for all Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, Premium and Essential members.Crime Boss: Rockay CityIf we're being honest, Crime Boss: Rockay City wasn't GOTY material when it first launched. the co-op heist-simulator is rough around the edges, but what it does have going for it a campaign anchored by purposefully over-the-top voice-acting featuring a cast of Hollywood actors like the late Michael Madsen, Michael Rooker, and at least two famous Dannys. Chuck Norris also plays the bad guy, and it's downright weird whenever he enters a cutscene.Free to play for all Xbox users.TrailmakersThis cute open-world game is all about exploration and adventure, and it offers support for co-op multiplayer.Free to play for all Xbox users.Big Helmet HeroesA 3D beat'-em-up adventure starring adorable knights, Big Helmet Heroes tasks the defenders of the realm with rescuing a princess and bashing their way to victory.Free to play for all Xbox users.Wild BastardsThe spiritual successor to Void Bastards takes everything that made that game great and adds several overlapping gameplay systems that inspire you to get creative in this strategy-shooter and roguelite hybrid.Free to play for all Xbox users with a two-hour time-limited trial.

title: Fortnite Screwed Up Apu's Look In The New Simpsons Season, And Epic Is Fixing It
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.  By     Eddie Makuch   on November 6, 2025 at 10:55AM...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
By 
    Eddie Makuch
   on November 6, 2025 at 10:55AM PST
              
          
                Epic Games has acknowledged a mistake with its new Simpsons update in Fortnite pertaining to the character Apu Nahasapeemapetilon.After the new season began, people quickly noticed that an image of Apu shows the character with the same yellow skin tone as his fellow The Be Sharps quartet members Homer, Barney, and Principal Skinner.This was a mistake and Epic will fix it. "This wasn't intentional. It's being adjusted in our next release," Epic said.The picture can be found in Moe's Tavern, and the venue also hosts a picture of Homer, Moe, Otto, and Apu, and in that photo, Apu has the screen-accurate skin tone from the TV show. Given that, many assumed this was an oversight on Epic's part, and that does indeed seem to be true.Apu has been sidelined in some ways on The Simpsons TV series, as the character has not spoken a word on the show for years after actor Hank Azaria announced that he would stop voicing him. This came after the documentary The Problem with Apu brought up a discussion about negative racial stereotypes.The Fortnite x Simpsons season has been a big hit, propelling Fortnite to the biggest player numbers since 2024.The new Fortnite season, which runs through November 29, brings a new Springfield map to Fortnite featuring locations like Moe's Tavern, the Kwik-E-Mart, and the Springfield nuclear plant. There is also a new Simpsons battle pass, which includes skins for characters like Homer and Marge, along with variants like Stupid Sexy Flanders. Epic is also offering up a free Kang and Kodos glider for people who link their Epic and MyDisney accounts.Looking ahead, Fortnite dataminers believe they've found evidence pointing to future collaborations with SpongeBob SquarePants and Harry Potter.
